bottled-water.title: Bottled water
bottled-water.shortDesc: Final ozonation in drinking water bottling
bottled-water.content:
Final ozonation is a key step in bottled drinking water production. The technology sterilizes water, packaging and equipment immediately before filling, preventing secondary microbiological contamination.

Under sanitary standards, ozonation is the preferred method for disinfecting drinking water. Chlorine is not permitted for bottled water. Ozone fully decays to oxygen, saturating the water and improving taste.

At residual ozone up to 0.1 mg/L and contact time of at least 12 minutes, full sterilization of water, bottle, headspace and cap is achieved. The product remains sterile until the package is opened.
benefits: Simultaneous sterilization of water and packaging

stat3.label: Performance
stat3.description: Recommended ozone generator dose per water volume

intro.text: Drinking water producers often face situations where water extracted from a verified well and passed through all purification stages spoils on store shelves. The cause is secondary contamination directly on the bottling line through contact with air, equipment and non-sterile containers.
intro.text2: Final ozonation solves this problem comprehensively: ozone not only disinfects water but also disinfects bottling equipment and sterilizes containers. After capping bottles, ozone decomposes to oxygen within several hours, leaving no traces and improving water taste.

highlight1.title: Sanitary standards:
highlight1.text: "Chlorine preparations are not permitted for treating drinking waters intended for bottling; preferred disinfection methods are ozonation and physical treatment methods, in particular UV irradiation."

benefits.title: Advantages of final ozonation
items: Simultaneous sterilization of water, bottle, headspace and cap
Environment remains sterile until package opening
Oxygen saturation — mandatory requirement for premium category water
Complete ozone decay to oxygen without chemical residues
Only permitted preservation method for baby water
No need for additional container disinfection

highlight.text: For baby water, ozonation is possibly the only preservation option, since use of silver ions and carbon dioxide is prohibited by standards.

scheme.title: Final ozonation schematic
scheme.text: Ozonation system is placed directly before the bottling machine. The system includes oxygen generator, ozone generator, ozone delivery and dissolution system, as well as ozone analyzer or ORP meter for control.

limitations.title: Limitations for mineral water
limitations.text: When ozonating mineral water, impurities oxidizable by ozone are not permitted: iron, manganese, hydrogen sulfide, bromide, natural organic substances. Ozone reaction with bromide leads to bromate formation, the standard content of which in drinking water is 10 μg/L.
limitations.text2: Dissolved metals after interaction with ozone convert to insoluble oxides, leading to color and sediment in water. Therefore, before final ozonation, water must be pre-treated in accordance with standards.

dairy.title: Dairy production
dairy.content:
Ozonation in the dairy industry is used to disinfect equipment, tanks, milk lines and premises. The technology reduces the need for chemical detergents and ensures microbiological safety.

Ozonated water at 2–3 mg/L effectively disinfects cooling tanks, milking equipment and pipelines with 99.9% efficiency. Ozone destroys pathogens, including thermophilic bacteria resistant to pasteurization.

In cold storage of dairy products, chamber ozonation prevents mold and extends shelf life of cottage cheese, sour cream and other fermented products by 30–50%.

intro.paragraph1: The dairy industry has the highest requirements for microbiological safety. Pathogenic microorganisms — Listeria, Salmonella, E.coli — can survive even after pasteurization, multiplying in milk lines and on equipment surfaces.
intro.paragraph2: Ozonation solves this problem comprehensively: disinfecting cooling tanks, milking equipment, milk lines and storage tanks without using chemical detergents. Ozone is effective against thermophilic bacteria resistant to high temperatures.

haccpHighlight.title: HACCP:
haccpHighlight.text: Ozonation is recognized as a critical control point (CCP) in the hazard analysis system, allowing control of microbiological safety at all stages of dairy production.

storage.title: Dairy product storage
storage.intro: Ozonation of cold rooms for dairy product storage prevents mold development, suppresses psychrotrophic bacteria growth and extends shelf life of cottage cheese, sour cream, yogurt by 30–50%.

highlight.text: In cold storage, ozonation not only suppresses microflora but also prevents off-flavors in products, which is especially important for long-term butter storage.

listeriosis.title: Listeriosis prevention
listeriosis.paragraph1: Listeria monocytogenes is one of the most dangerous pathogens in the dairy industry. The bacterium can multiply at refrigerator temperature (+4°C), survive in biofilms on equipment surfaces and cause severe diseases with fatal outcomes.
listeriosis.paragraph2: Ozone effectively destroys Listeria biofilms and kills bacterial cells. At ozone concentration of 0.5–1.0 mg/L in water, 99.99% inactivation of L. monocytogenes is achieved within 5 minutes of contact.

meat-sausages.title: Meat and sausages
meat-sausages.shortDesc: Meat storage and sausage ripening chambers
meat-sausages.content:
Ozonation is an effective disinfection method in meat production and storage. It is used to treat cold rooms, sausage ripening chambers and meat surfaces without changing sensory properties.

For chilled meat storage, ozonation at 8–10 mg/m³ for 4–5 hours every other day extends shelf life 2–5 times. Ozone destroys mesophilic and psychrotrophic microflora on carcass surfaces at 1–4°C.

For sausage ripening chambers, 3–8 mg/m³ with daily 3-hour treatment is recommended. Disinfection efficiency reaches 96–99% while preserving taste, aroma and texture.

shelfLife.label: Shelf life
shelfLife.description: Extended shelf life of chilled meat

organoleptics.label: Organoleptics
organoleptics.description: Preservation of taste, color and aroma

intro.paragraph1: During sausage ripening and meat storage, bacteria, mold fungi and yeasts actively develop. This leads to product spoilage, taste changes, mass loss and reduced shelf life. Ozonation is an effective, eco-friendly and safe disinfection method.
intro.paragraph2: Ozone's disinfecting effect is 15-20 times stronger than chlorine, and approximately 300-600 times stronger against spore-forming bacteria. At the same time, ozone completely decays to oxygen, leaving no chemical residues on the product surface.

instruction.text: Ozonation is recommended for receiving, storing and releasing sausage products and smoked goods. The method allows disinfecting chambers together with loaded products.

storage.title: Chilled meat storage
storage.paragraph: For chilled meat storage, ozonation at 8-10 mg/m³ ensures complete destruction of mesophilic and psychrotrophic microflora on carcass surfaces at 1-4°C. Chilled meat shelf life increases 2-5 times.

ripeningChambers.title: Sausage ripening chambers
ripeningChambers.paragraph: In ripening chambers for dry-cured and air-dried sausages, ozone suppresses development of slimy and mold deposits, preventing off-odors. At moderate concentration, ozone does not cause discoloration of casing or filling.
ripeningChambers.tableCaption: Ozonation regimes for sausage ripening chambers

recommendedMode.label: Recommended regime:
recommendedMode.text: Daily treatment for 1-3 hours. During treatment, no personnel should be in the chamber. Ozonator capacity: 1 g/hour per 20-25 m³ chamber volume.

cheese.title: Cheese production
cheese.shortDesc: Ripening and storage of cheese without mold
cheese.content:
In cheese production, ozonation addresses the key issue of preventing unwanted mold on cheese surfaces during ripening and storage. The technology controls chamber microflora without affecting the ripening process.

For hard cheeses, 2–4 mg/m³ ozone is recommended; for soft cheeses, 3–6 mg/m³ at 8–12°C and 85–90% humidity. Treatment for 1.5–2 hours gives 94–99% disinfection efficiency.

Ozone prevents mold on the rind without disrupting ripening biochemistry. At correct dosage it does not affect color, consistency or taste. Ozonation has been recommended for hard cheese storage in industry guidelines.

tastePreservation.description: Does not affect the ripening process

intro.paragraph1: In cheese production, ozonation addresses the key issue of preventing unwanted mold on cheese surfaces during ripening and storage. The technology controls chamber microflora without affecting the biochemical ripening processes.
intro.paragraph2: Ozone prevents mold development on the cheese rind without disrupting the balance of beneficial microflora inside the cheese head. At correct dosage, ozone does not affect the color, consistency, taste, or aroma of the finished product.

regimes.warningText: For cheeses like Camembert, Brie, and Roquefort, a gentle ozonation regime (1-2 mg/m³, 30 minutes) is required to control unwanted mold without damaging the cultured mold.

cold-storage.title: Cold storage
cold-storage.shortDesc: Disinfection and deodorization of cold stores
cold-storage.content:
Ozonation of cold rooms and warehouses is a proven technology for extending food shelf life and removing odors. It has major advantages over "wet" disinfection.

Treatment can be done without warming the chamber or unloading product. At lower temperatures, ozonation is more effective. Chamber downtime is reduced by a factor of about 5 compared with traditional methods.

For empty chambers, 35–40 mg/m³ for 24 hours is recommended. For loaded chambers, 2–10 mg/m³ depending on product type. Ozone suppresses bacterial flora, prevents mold and removes musty odor.

downtimeReduction.label: Faster
downtimeReduction.description: Reduction in chamber downtime for disinfection

intro.paragraph1: Disinfection and deodorization of cold storage facilities is one of the most important sanitary and hygienic measures aimed at preventing spoilage and quality degradation of stored food products. Ozonation has significant advantages over "wet" disinfection methods.
intro.paragraph2: Practice has shown that ozonation of cold storage chambers and warehouses allows extending product shelf life, removing unpleasant odors and preventing mold colony formation — all without warming the chamber or unloading products.
intro.instructionText: "Disinfection and deodorization in cold storage facilities by ozonation" — working ozone concentration for disinfection of empty chambers: 35-40 mg/m³, ozonation duration 24 hours.

benefits.title: Advantages of cold storage ozonation
items: Ability to disinfect chambers loaded with food products
Treatment without warming the chamber — effectiveness increases at low temperatures
Reduction of chamber downtime by 5 times compared to "wet" disinfection
Indispensable for combating musty odors in cold storage
Suppression of bacterial flora on walls, grates, hooks, pallets
Prevention of mold on storage walls, boxes and packaging
Energy savings — no need for repeated cooling
Minimal labor costs — automated process

emptyChambers.title: Ozonation of empty chambers
emptyChambers.intro: Empty chambers are cleaned of snow, ice, product residues and visible mold colonies before ozonation. The snow "coat" must be removed. Chamber doors are tightly closed, and connecting air channels are blocked with dampers.
emptyChambers.tableCaption: Ozone decay periods after ozonator shutdown
emptyChambers.warning: For chambers heavily contaminated with mold and chambers with persistent odors, ozonation duration may be increased to 36, and in some cases — up to 48 hours.

deodorization.title: Cold storage deodorization
deodorization.paragraph1: Ozonation is indispensable for combating musty odors that form in cold storage and freezer chambers. During deodorization, chambers are held after ozonator shutdown for 24 hours without ventilation — ozone fully decays to oxygen.
deodorization.paragraph2: Ozone oxidizes and destroys organic compounds that cause unpleasant odors. This allows using one chamber to store different types of products alternately without risk of odor transfer.

organization.title: Ozonation process organization
organization.intro: In the ozonated chamber, the ozonator is installed in the middle of the chamber on a table approximately 1.2 m high. With two or three ozonators, they are placed at different points in the chamber for even ozone distribution. Air cooler fans are turned off.
organization.recommendationText: To increase ozonation effectiveness after reaching working concentration, it is recommended to briefly turn on fans to mix the ozone-air mixture.
